'''''Transactions of the Philological Society 1934''''' is a journal issue published in 1934.

It publishes Tolkien's essay "[[Chaucer as a Philologist: The Reeve's Tale]]". In the lecture (delivered on 16 May 1931) Tolkien discusses Chaucer’s use of the Northern Middle English dialect as a linguistic joke in The Reeve’s Tale. The essay was reprinted in [[Tolkien Studies: Volume 5|''Tolkien Studies'': Volume 5]] in [[2008]].<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details2.php?id=243|articlename=The Reeve’s Tale|website=TB|accessed=6 May 2019}}</ref>
